description: From Middle English transgressioun, from Old French transgression, from Late Latin trānsgressiō, from Latin trānsgressus (perfect active participle of trānsgredior (“I step across”)) + -iō.

entries.meaning: A violation of a law, duty or commandment.
An act that goes beyond generally accepted boundaries.
(geology)  A relative rise in sea level resulting in deposition of marine strata over terrestrial strata.
